root.Description:
Compass Plus Price Calculator Tool Self-service Portal

Dear user,

This portal provides access to Price Calculator Tool (hereinafter, PCT) and your personal version of the configuration for it. Access to this portal, PCT and your configuration is personal and shall not be shared with anyone else. Configuration file contains all of your personal settings, including maximum allowed discount rates and available regions, along with the price lists.

Documentation for PCT is still being developed and once available, the link for it will be posted on this portal.

Should you run into any problems, have questions or suggestions, please file them on corporate JIRA in Sales Department project, PCT Support component, by following this link. Make sure that you choose PCT Support component when filing, otherwise your issue will not be routed properly.

Installation instructions

In order to install PCT you will need to download PCT distribution (zip archive) from the list of downloads below, as well as your personal PCT configuration, by clicking on the link in the PCT Configuration section of this portal. Please note that configuration should be protected by a strong password (minimum of 8 characters) that you will be requested to enter while downloading configuration file. This password will need to be entered every time when you start PCT on your computer, so make sure you remember it.

Please note that configuration has expiration period. Whenever your configuration expires, or shortly before that, new configuration with extended expiration date will become available on this portal.

Once both files have been downloaded, extract PCT distribution (all of the contents of the zip archive) in a new folder on your computer, and place configuration file, which should be named config.exml. After that PCT could be started by double clicking on PCT.jar.

It is necessary that PCT.jar, templates folder and config.exml are all located in one folder, make sure that it is so before running PCT.

If your computer can not run PCT.jar, make sure you have latest JAVA Run-time Environment (JRE) installed. It can be downloaded from this website.

If you have Nokia PC Suite installed you might be unable to run PCT.jar directly. In such case you should download special runner from the section below (PCT_start.vbs) and place it in the same folder as PCT.jar. After that PCT could be started by double clicking on PCT_start.vbs.

PCT Configuration

To get latest PCT configuration use form below

Password
Repeat password

If you can't download the configuration, it may be a browser-related problem. Make sure that you use latest version of Internet Explorer, Fire Fox or Google Chrome. Some older version of Internet Explorer are unable to download the configuration

License.Name: TPM-only (only TPM, FIs, number of nodes and admin workstations are licensed)
Instance based (all possible capacities licensed, instances instead of nodes)

Module.Name: Windows OS
Module.Hint: Support for MS Windows Server 2008 and newer.

Module.Name: Linux OS
Module.Hint: Support for RedHat Enterprise Linux version 5 and newer.

Module.Name: AIX OS
Module.Hint: Support for IBM AIX version 6.1 and newer.

Module.Name: Fault Tolerant Option
Module.Hint: Highly available and redundant configuration of TranzWare Online. The module itself includes support for 'Bridges' and is not enough without sufficient number of instances licensed. The bare minimum is 4, but it is dependent on the other parameters and significantly more instances may be required.

Module.Name: X.25 Support
Module.Hint: Support for X.25 connectivity. Requires either Eicon synchronous serial interface card, or XOT (X.25 over TCP) capable router such as those from Motorolla or Cisco.

Module.Name: Multi-stream Extract and Refresh procedures
Module.Hint: Support for parallel processing of Extract and Refresh files. Only required for customers doing (roughly) more than 2 million transactions/day.

Module.Name: Stand-in Authorizer
Module.Hint: Required for card issuing with authorization by TranzWare Online.

Module.Name: Algorithmix
Module.Hint: Scripting engine providing customization capabilities to end-users.

Module.Name: Prepaid products distribution engine
Module.Hint: Required for distribution of top-up vouchers and other form of prepaid content. Not to be confused with prepaid cards.

Module.Name: Online Fraud Prevention interface to TW Fraud Analyzer
Module.Hint: Online interface to TranzWare Fraud Analyzer for transaction scoring during authorization. Based on the score assigned by TranzWare Fraud Analyzer the authorization engine will make the decision whether transaction should be authorized or not.

Module.Name: Customer Notification System (SMS-notification)
Module.Hint: Factility to notify customer of transactions proccessed on his cards/accounts and certain events, such as account balance change, card expiration approaching, etc. Could either be done by SMS or email.

Module.Name: Customer Notification System Active Functions (SMS-banking)
Module.Hint: Active (pull) SMS banking services, such as balance request, transfer, payment, etc. Set of commands and transactions associated with them are configurable by the end-user. Requires Customer Notification System basic module.

Module.Name: SMS/e-mail one-time password second factor authentication
Module.Hint: Support for second factor of authentication via SMS. Should be licensed with FIMI or Internet Banking. Doesn't make much sense on its own.

Module.Name: Bank Messaging System (BMS)
Module.Hint: Customer interaction facility, including all delivery channel that are licensed to the customer: ATMs, FIMI and Internet Banking.

Module.Name: Card-based payment (utility, bill, etc) on all supported channels
Loyalty support for POS-terminals
Module.Hint: Support for loyalty functions at POS-terminals. Requires Core Loyalty module.

Module.Name: Verified by VISA Issuing Support (ACS interface)
DCI ATM Acquiring
Module.Hint: DCI ATM acquiring is done via PULSE network, which belongs to Discover as well as Diners Club.

Module.Name: Global Network Services (GNS) ISO Direct Interface
Global Network Services (GNS) ISO Direct Interface
Other Payment Scheme (generic placeholder)
Module.Hint: This is a generic place-holder to be used when the customer needs a number of unnamed yet-to-be-created interfaces to regional payment schemes to be included in the proposal.

Module.Name: Smartlink (Vietnam)
Module.Hint: Interface to Smartlink switch in Vietnam.

Module.Name: UAE Switch (UAE)
Module.Hint: In TWO this is just a variant of 123 interface, which is based on BASE24, no separate interface implementation exists.

Module.Name: Bersama (Indonesia)
Module.Hint: Interface to Bersama ATM network in Indonesia.

Module.Name: SUDAPAN (Sudan)
Module.Hint: Interface for National Switch in Sudan - previously implemented to migrate from S2M solution, now used for connectivity of Switch members to TranzWare Online.

Module.Name: NAPS (Qatar)
Module.Hint: Interface to the National Switch operated by Central Bank of Qatar.

Module.Name: MEPS (Malaysia)
Module.Hint: Interface to MEPS (interbank switch) in Malaysia. In TWO implemented as a variant of NAPS interface.

Module.Name: TranzWare InterConnect
Module.Hint: Native ISO8583 implementation for TranzWare Online.

Module.Name: Other Host (generic placeholder)
Module.Hint: This is a generic place-holder to be used when the customer needs a number of unnamed yet-to-be-created host-to-host interfaces to be included in the proposal.

Module.Name: Base24 (ACI)
Module.Hint: Interface to Base24 and Base24-eps by ACI Worldwide.

Module.Name: CTL Online (TSYS)
Module.Hint: Interface to CTL Online, now owned by TSYS, based on their DHI specification.

Module.Name: TransMaster (Tieto Enator)
Module.Hint: Interface to TransMaster of Card Suite by Tieto Enator.

Module.Name: Trans24 (ACI)
Module.Hint: Interface to Trans24 by ACI Worldwide. The product is no longer sold by ACI.

Module.Name: Way4 (OpenWay)
Module.Hint: Interface to Way4 by OpenWay.

Module.Name: STEPS-II (Logica)
Module.Hint:
Interface to STEPS-II by Logica, the system was originally developed and marketed by BankSys out of Belgium. Legacy product, not sold any more.
NOT PRESENT IN TWO!

Module.Name: Magix Funchip
Module.Hint: Defunct product by M2M out of Marocco, marketed by Ingenico in the 1990-s. Not sold any more. In TWO implemented as a variant of BASE24 interface.

Module.Name: Postilion (S1)
Module.Hint: Interface to Postilion by S1, now part of ACI.

Module.Name: BankWorks (RS/2)
Module.Hint: Interface to original BankWorks by RS/2.

Module.Name: ARKSYS (EuroNet)
Module.Hint: Interface to ARKSYS, now owned by EuroNet.

Module.Name: OST24
Module.Hint: Interface to OST24 developed (and believed not to be any longer) marketed by a local software provider in Russia.

Module.Name: IST/Switch (FIS)
Module.Hint: Interface to IST/Switch, originally developed by OASIS, now owned by FIS.

Module.Name: Electra (ECS)
Module.Hint: Interface to Electra by ElectraCard Services, more commonly known as Opus out of India.

Module.Name: HSCB interface for TechComBank in Vietnam (HTV)
Module.Hint: Interface to HSBC regional host for TechComBank in Vietnam.

Module.Name: SmartVista (BPC)
Module.Hint:
Interface to SmartVista Front-End by BPC.
NOT PRESENT IN TWO!!!

Module.Name: TPII (IFS)
Module.Hint: Interface to original TPII by IFS.

Module.Name: TranzWare Corebanking Interface (TCI)
Module.Hint: Native TranzWare ISO8583 implementation for interfacing with Core Banking Systems.

Module.Name: TranzWare CMS Corebanking Interface
Module.Hint: Online interface to TranzWare CMS, used mostly for information requests, such as to pull list of operations from archive, obtain information from the contract (financial scheme) in order to be presented in one of the delivery channels. Does not support any financial operations, can't be used for authorization.

Module.Name: Other Core Banking System interface (generic placeholder)
Module.Hint: This is a generic place-holder to be used when the customer needs a number of unnamed yet-to-be-created core banking interfaces to be included in the proposal.

Module.Name: FlexCube (iFlex)
Module.Hint: Interface to FlexCube Core Banking System by iFlex (India), based on ISO8583 specification provided by iFlex.

Module.Name: Equation - D8 (Misys)
Module.Hint: Interface to Equation by Misys, via middleware developed by D8, used in Latvia. It should be noted, that Equation does not seem to have standard interface. That is why local partners, and occassionally Misys itself, develop interface as bespoke customization for each customer. Therefore this particular interface is not something readily available to be replicated at other customers' site.

Module.Name: Globus / T24 (Temenos)
Module.Hint: Interface to Globus and T24 Core Banking Systems by Temenos. It should be noted that the original interface was developed for Globus at TechComBank. TechComBank has since migrated to T24 and the interface is still in use, it is thus reasonable to believe they are compatible. Globus is no longer sold by Temenos, their flagship product now is T24.

Module.Name: Finacle (Infosys)
Module.Hint: Interface to Finacle Core Banking System by Infosys (India), based on ISO8583.

Module.Name: Equation - ABK (Misys)
Module.Hint:
Interface to Equation by Misys.
NEED TO COLLECT INFORMATION ON THIS IMPLEMENTATION!!!

Module.Name: ABCS INCAS (Silverlake)
Module.Hint: Interface to INCAS Core Banking System by Silverlake. Originally implemented for VietInBank in Vietnam.

Module.Name: OTHA (Pexim)
Module.Hint: Interface to OTHA Core Banking System by Pexim (Serbia).

Module.Name: Postilion Core Banking Interface (S1 / InterSwitch)
Module.Hint: Interface developed by S1/InterSwitch in Nigeria for connectivity to a range of Core Banking Systems for local Postilion users.

Module.Name: User-Defined Payment Interface (UDPI)
Module.Hint: UDPI allows end-users to create new payment interfaces through Algorithmix. Such payment interfaces are primarily limited to text-based protocols (non-binary) such as web services.

Module.Name: CyberPlat (Russia)
Module.Hint: Interface to CyberPlat payment aggregator in Russia.

Module.Name: Megafon (Russia)
Module.Hint: Interface to Megafon mobile network operator in Russia for account top-up.

Module.Name: ESPG (Russia)
Module.Hint: Interface to ESPG payment aggregator (former Burokrat) in Russia.

Module.Name: EBPP GOROD (Russia)
Module.Hint: Interface to EBPP system operator Gorod in Russia.

Module.Name: SADAD (Kingdom of Saudi Arabia)
Module.Hint: Interface to EBPP system SADAD in KSA.

Module.Name: e-Port (Russia)
Module.Hint: Interface to e-Port payment aggregator in Russia.

Module.Name: Virtual Top-Up for MTN Nigeria
Module.Hint: Interface to MTN mobile network operator in Nigeria for account top-up.

Module.Name: Nigerian Sports Lottery
Module.Hint: Interface to Nigerian Sports Lottery for account top-up.

Module.Name: Other payment aggregator / vendor interface (generic placeholder)
Module.Hint: This is a generic place-holder to be used when the customer needs a number of unnamed yet-to-be-created payment aggregator / vendor interfaces to be included in the proposal.

Capacity.Name: Number of transactions processed per month
Number of ATMs connected to the system
Number of POS-terminals connected to the system
Number of Financial Institutions served by the system
Number of nodes to run the system on
Capacity.Hint: Number of computers that the system can be installed upon and simultaneously running. If a customer would like to have redundant active-active cluster in the primary data center - two would be the minimum value. If they also want to add active-active DR site, then at least 3 would be required. The license does not depend on the number of CPUs installed in each machine, and does not limit number of copies (instances) of the application running on them.

Capacity.Name: Number of transactions processed per month (TPM-only)
Number of administrative workstations (concurrent users)
Capacity.Hint: Number of concurrent users accessing the system via native GUI client.

Capacity.Name: Number of FIMI concurrent users
Capacity.Hint: Number of concurrent users accessing FIMI web application. Does not apply to FIMI web-service.

Dependencies.Require: TWO-MC-ACQ-DIRECT-INTERFACE TWO-DCI-ISS-AP-DI TWO-DCI-ISS-RU-DI TWO-DCI-ACQ-GLOBAL-DI TWO-DCI-ACQ-AP-DI TWO-DCI-ACQ-RU-DI

Capacity.Name: Number of Other interfaces
Capacity.Hint: Number of interfaces yet-to-be-created for regional payment schemes.

Capacity.Name: Number of other interfaces
Capacity.Hint: This is a generic place-holder to be used when the customer needs a number of unnamed yet-to-be-created host-to-host interfaces to be included in the proposal.

Capacity.Name: Number of other interfaces
Capacity.Hint: This is a generic place-holder to be used when the customer needs a number of unnamed yet-to-be-created core banking interfaces to be included in the proposal.

Capacity.Name: Number of Nigerian Sports Lottery interfaces
Number of other payment aggregator / vendor interfaces
Capacity.Hint: This is a generic place-holder to be used when the customer needs a number of unnamed yet-to-be-created payment aggregator / vendor interfaces to be included in the proposal.

License.Name: In package with other TranzWare products

Module.Name: MS Windows
Module.Hint: Support for Microsoft Windows Server 2008 and newer.

Module.Name: Linux
Module.Hint: Support for RedHat Enterprise Linux 5 and newer.

Module.Name: IBM AIX
Module.Hint: Support for IBM AIX version 6 and newer.

Module.Name: Protocol Converter
Module.Hint: Most basic function of TranzWare Interchange - protocol conversion between various supported formats. Always included with the product.

Module.Name: Controlled and Sponsored Associations
Module.Hint: Support for Controlled and Sponsored Associations. Provides functionality for multi-institutional clearing and settlement in a closed-loop payment system, or clearing and settlement with/on behalf of a number agents and external payment scheme.

Module.Name: TranzWare Interchange Protocol
Module.Hint: Clearing and settlement protocol native to TranzWare products. Used for clearing and settlement transactions data transfer between TranzWare products.

Module.Name: Visa CTF (BASEII) and Settlement Service
Module.Hint: Support for Visa CTF (BASEII) and Settlement Service file formats for import and export.

Module.Name: Visa IRF (Interchange Reimbursement Fee) Forecast Module
Module.Hint: Basic IRF forecast facilities, does not come with any country-specific rules.

Module.Name: MasterCard IPM family
Module.Hint: Support for MasterCard IPM file format for import and export. Includes MasterCard SAFE (fraud reporting format), MasterCard GCMS (Global Clearing Management Services), MasterCard BEDF (Billing Electronic Data File), MasterCard MDS (Debit Switch Settlement) and MasterCard IRD (Interchange Rate Designator) BSA-based method support with IRD optimization.

Module.Name: MasterCard ECCF
Module.Hint: Support for MasterCard ECCF (old EuroPay) file format for import and export.

Module.Name: MasterCard MIGS
Module.Hint: Incoming interface for transaction import from MasterCard MIGS (e-commerce acquiring platform).

Module.Name: American Express GNS (Global Network Services)
Module.Hint: Clearing interface to AmEx's central processing facility - GNS.

Module.Name: American Express 11 (Russia and CIS)
Module.Hint: Clearing interface AMEX 11 for Russia and CIS. There are implementations in Russia and Ukraine at the moment.

Module.Name: JCB Clearing
Module.Hint: Clearing interface to JCB, includes JCB Merchant Data File support.

Module.Name: Union Pay (China)
Module.Hint: Clearing and settlement interface to Union Pay (China).

Module.Name: Diners Club International
Module.Hint: Clearing interface with Diners Club's central processing facility.

Module.Name: BankNetVN (Vietnam) Clearing and Settlement Interface
Module.Hint: Clearing and settlement interface to BankNetVN in Vietnam.

Module.Name: TecBan (Brazil) Clearing Interface
Module.Hint: Clearing interface to TecBan ATM network in Brazil

Module.Name: PULSE EFT (USA) Clearing Interface
Module.Hint: Clearing interface to PULSE EFT network in USA.

Module.Name: SPAN (KSA)
Module.Hint: Incoming interface from SPAN in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

Module.Name: TransMaster (Tieto Enator)
Module.Hint: Proprietary clearing and settlement interface to TransMaster by Tieto Enator.

Module.Name: Card Galaxy
Module.Hint: Clearing interface (incoming only) with Card Galaxy (Vendor???).

Capacity.Name: Number of transactions processed per month
Capacity.Hint: Number of transactions processed by the system per month for clearing, settlement or format conversion purposes. All transactions are counted against this limit irrespective of their type.

Capacity.Name: Number of Financial Institutions served by the system
Capacity.Hint: Number of financial insitutions served by the system, either for protocol conversion or multi-institutional clearing and settlement.

Capacity.Name: Number of concurrent users
Capacity.Hint: Maximum number of users that can access system concurrently.

Module.Name: MS Windows
Module.Hint: TranzWare Card Factory runs under MS Windows only.

Module.Name: SafeNet ProtectServer Gold
Module.Hint: Basic, cheap and multi-functional choice in the form of either internal PCI card or stand-alone box. Support for it includes firmware that enables EMV data preparation and electric personalization of a wide choice of chips.

Module.Name: SafeNet Luna
Module.Hint: More expensive version of ProtectServer Gold, but with the same firmware approach.

Module.Name: Thales RG7XXX and HSM8XXX
Module.Hint: Support for Thales 7XXX and 8XXX series. Requires additional firmware to be licensed from Thales for EMV data preparation and electric personalization of chip cards. Limited set of chips supported for this HSM type.

Module.Name: PIN-mailer
Module.Hint: Most basic function - generates PIN and associated magstripe cryptography values (PVV, CVV). Requires at least one type of HSM.

Module.Name: EMV Data Preparation
Module.Hint: EMV data preparation - generation of all necessary cryptography values and key derivation, management of associated data profiles. Requires at least one type of HSM.

Module.Name: Card Personalization - Magnetic Stripe
Module.Hint: Personalization of magnetic stripe cards: embossing, printing and encoding of magnetic stripe. Requires at least one type of personalization equipment.

Module.Name: Card Personalization - EMV
Module.Hint: Electric personalization of EMV cards. Requires magstripe card personalization capability, HSM and at least one type of chips and perso equipment.

Module.Name: P3 Data File Export
Module.Hint: Support for P3 Data File to export prepared EMV data.

Module.Name: Visa VSDC
Module.Hint: Support for standard VSDC contact-based application.

Module.Name: Visa PayWave
Module.Hint: Support for contactless version of VSDC - PayWave.

Module.Name: MasterCard M/Chip
Module.Hint: Support for M/Chip Lite 4 and Select 4.

Module.Name: MasterCard PayPass
Module.Hint: Support for contactless M/Chip version - PayPass.

Module.Name: JCOP 20 and 30
Module.Hint: Support for Java Card Open Platform - open industry standard.

Module.Name: MultOS
Module.Hint: Support for MultOS - open industry standard. Implementation that we have tested was based on Gemalto cards, but should work with any other.

Module.Name: Gemalto Cyberflex Palmera Swift and Protect
Module.Hint: Support for native card by Gemalto - Cyberflex Palmer Swift and Protect.

Module.Name: Gemalto Optelio
Module.Hint: Support for native card by Gemalto - Optelio.

Module.Name: Gemalto eGalleon G2
Module.Hint: Support for native card by Gemalto - eGalleon G2.

Module.Name: Austria Card Native
Module.Hint: Support for native card (which?) by Austria Card.

Module.Name: Kona 20, 23s, 121 contactless, 132, 151S
Module.Hint: Support for chips from Korea Electronic Banking Technology.

Module.Name: DataCard DC-280, DC-210, DC-275, DC-295
Module.Hint: Support for desktop series from DataCard.

Module.Name: DataCard DC-150i
Module.Hint: Support for DC-150i desktop embosser from DataCard.

Module.Name: DataCard DC-SE48
Module.Hint: Support for DC-SE48 desktop embosser from DataCard.

Module.Name: DataCard DC-SP55
Module.Hint: Support for DC-SP55 desktop embosser from DataCard.

Module.Name: DataCard DC-450
Module.Hint: Support for mid-range embosser from DataCard - DC-450.

Module.Name: DataCard DC-500 (SCPM)
Module.Hint: Support for DataCard DC-500, includes support for SCPM (aka Affina) which is necessary for EMV card perso on this device type.

Module.Name: DataCard DC-7000 (SCPM)
Module.Hint: Support for DataCard DC-7000, includes support for SCPM (aka Affina) which is necessary for EMV card perso on this device type.

Module.Name: DataCard DC-9000 (SCPM)
Module.Hint: Support for DataCard DC-9000, includes support for SCPM (aka Affina) which is necessary for EMV card perso on this device type.

Module.Name: DataCard MX-6000 (SCPM)
Module.Hint: Support for DataCard MX-6000, includes support for SCPM (aka Affina) which is necessary for EMV card perso on this device type.

Module.Name: CIM Combi1000Pro and Combi2000Pro
Module.Hint: EMV compatible embosser by CIM, integration via MultiCard firmware.

Module.Name: CIM 1000Pro and 2000Pro
Module.Hint: EMV compatible embosser by CIM, integration via MultiCard firmware.

Module.Name: CIM MAXIMA 861
Module.Hint: EMV compatible embosser by CIM, integration via MultiCard firmware.

Module.Name: CIM MAXIMA 862
Module.Hint: EMV compatible embosser by CIM, direct interface.

Module.Name: CIM E2000
Module.Hint: EMV compatible embosser by CIM, integration via MultiCard firmware.

Module.Name: CIM MultiFeeder MF6000 Pro-Series
Module.Hint: Support for top-range CIM Embosser - MultiFeeder MF6000 Pro-Series.

Module.Name: CIMage Optima (K300 CE, K300 CEM) printer
Module.Hint: Support for CIMage printers and EMV card encoders.

Module.Name: Matica Z-series
Module.Hint: Support for Matica embossers Z-series.

Module.Name: NBS Advantage M2000
Module.Hint: Support for NBS Advantage M2000 embosser, magstripe only, no EMV support.

Module.Name: VeriFone P101 and 1000+ PIN-pad
Module.Hint: Support for VeriFone PIN-pads, used for PIN entry in instant issuing configuration.

Module.Name: Magtek KDT-400 magnetic stripe writer
Module.Hint: Support for desktop magnetic stripe writer from Magtek.

Module.Name: GemPC TWIN magnetic stripe and chip reader/writer
Module.Hint: Support for GemPC TWIN device for encoding of magstripe and EMV cards.

Module.Name: ACR30 magstripe writer
Module.Hint: Support for ACR30 mastripe writer.

Capacity.Name: Number of EMV cards personalized per year
Capacity.Hint: Number of EMV cards personalized using all of the stations/embossers are counted against this limit. Magstripe cards are not limited.

Capacity.Name: Number of stations
Capacity.Hint: Number of TranzWare Card Factory stations. One station is typically dedicated to one type of activity, such as PIN-printing, card printing/embossing, etc. Each embosser, if it is driven directly by TranzWare Card Factory would typically require dedicated station.

Capacity.Name: Number of financial institutions
Capacity.Hint: Number of financial institutions served by the system.

Module.Name: MS Windows
Module.Hint: Server-side support for MS Windows.

Module.Name: Linux
Module.Hint: Server-side support for Linux.

Module.Name: Internet Banking Portal
Module.Hint: TranzWare Internet Banking does not have any optional modules so far, therefore this is a single option which is always selected. VTBI protocol handler in TranzWare Online is required for TranzWare Internet Banking to function.

Module.Name: PDA / Mobile Devices Support
Module.Hint: Version of TW Internet Banking optimized for mobile / handheld devices.

Capacity.Name: Number of Financial Institutions
Capacity.Hint: Number of financial institutions which are served by TranzWare Internet Banking.

Module.Name: MS Windows
Module.Hint: Server-side support for Microsoft Windows.

Module.Name: Linux
Module.Hint: Server-side support for RedHat Linux.

Module.Name: Mobile JAVA applet
Module.Hint: Most basic version of Mobile Banking based on Mobile JAVA implementation.

Module.Name: Andriod
Module.Hint: Applet for Andriod-powered mobile phones.

Module.Name: Apple iOS
Module.Hint: Support for devices running Apple iOS. Still in beta stage!

Module.Name: Blackberry
Module.Hint: Not supported, and no plans to implement it.

Capacity.Name: Number of Financial Institutions
Capacity.Hint: Number of financial institutions served by the system.

Region.Name: Asia Pacific (All countries east of Pakistan and south of Russian Federation, except for Central Asian countries which are part of Domestic Region)
Middle East (Westwards from Pakistan all the way to Turkey and Jordan south of Domestic Region border.)
Africa (All countries on African continent, inclusive of nearby island nations such as Madagascar, Mauritius, Seychelles, Cape Verde and Sao Tome and Principe)
Domestic (except for Azerbaijan, Ukraine and Baltics)

AuthLevel.Name: License Fee Payment Terms
AuthLevel.Description: Payment terms for the initial license fees payable by the customer according to the proposal.
AuthLevel.MemoText: 1. 50% of the total license fee is due within 3 business days following the contract signature 2. 50% of the total license fee is due within 3 business days following the delivery of the software products
AuthLevel.MemoHeader: License Fee Payment Terms For This Proposal:

Level.Name: Standard
Level.Description: 1. First payment of at least 30% of the license fee is made no later than 30 calendar days following contract signature 2. Second and final payment of the remaining amount is made no later than 30 calendar days following delivery or installation (exact choice of event is at the discretion of the sales rep) of software products

Level.Name: Guaranteed within fixed period
Level.Description: 1. First payment of at least 20% of the total license fee is made no later than 30 calendar days following contract signature 2. Remaining amount is unconditionally paid within 2 year period following the contract signature

Level.Name: Unguaranteed conditional
Level.Description: 1. First payment of at least 20% of the total license fee is made no later than 30 calendar days following contract signature 2. Remaining amount is paid upon occurrence of certain event(s), such as 'go live', certification with payment scheme, successful acceptance testing, etc.

Level.Name: Nonstandard
Level.Description: Any other payment term that implies initial license fee being paid, but doesn’t fit definitions of the levels above. Lifetime license, and concepts similar to it, are not part of this level.

Level.Name: Lifetime license
Level.Description: 1. No initial license fee is paid upon contract signature 2. Lifetime license fee is paid by the customer on regular basis (monthly or quarterly) instead of the initial license fee for as long as the products are being used, i.e. it doesn't stop until the product use is discontinued 3. Amount of the annual lifetime license fee is calculated by dividing initial undiscounted license fee by five 4. Minimum term of lifetime license is that of six years, should customer choose to terminate earlier, a penalty calculated as 20% of the one-time license fee (total license cost) for each year the agreement was in force up to the moment of cancellation. Such penalty is charged in addition to the difference between one-time license fee (total license cost) and total amount of recurring license fees already paid up to the date of contract termination. 5. Lifetime license fees payment shall commence upon delivery or installation (exact event selection is at the sales rep discretion) of the software products 6. Lifetime license fees are not inclusive of maintenance and support payments, and those are to be paid separately

AuthLevel.Name: Professional Services Fees Payment Terms
AuthLevel.Description: Payment terms for all type of professional services by the customer according to the proposal.
AuthLevel.MemoText: 1. 30% of the total professional services fees value is due within 3 business days following the contract signature 2. Remaining amounts are due within 3 business days following the acceptance of the relevant delivery items 3. Customer is required to finalize acceptance testing of a particular delivery item within no later than 30 calendar days following the notification by Compass Plus of such delivery item being ready for acceptance testing. Should customer fail to finalize such acceptance testing in the allotted time period (bar any failure on Compass Plus side which caused delay to acceptance testing, and in such case acceptance testing period shall be extended by the amount of time attributable to such delay), such professional services shall be deemed accepted and payment for them due.
AuthLevel.MemoHeader: Professional Services Fees Payment Terms For This Proposal:

Level.Name: Standard
Level.Description: 1. Advance payment of at least 20% of the total value of professional services fees is made no later than 30 calendar days following contract signature 2. Remaining amounts are payable immediately (no later than 30 calendar days) following the acceptance of professional services 3. Customer is required to finalize acceptance testing of a particular delivery item within no later than 30 calendar days following the notification by Compass Plus of such delivery item being ready for acceptance testing. Should customer fail to finalize such acceptance testing in the allotted time period (bar any failure on Compass Plus side which caused delay to acceptance testing, and in such case acceptance testing period shall be extended by the amount of time attributable to such delay), such professional services shall be deemed accepted and payment for them due.

Level.Name: Deferred unconditionally
Level.Description: 1. Advance payment of at least 10% of the total value of professional services fees is made no later than 30 calendar days following contract signature 2. Remaining amounts are payable in full within no later than one calendar year following the acceptance of particular professional services items 3. Customer is required to finalize acceptance testing of a particular delivery item within no later than 30 calendar days following the notification by Compass Plus of such delivery item being ready for acceptance testing. Should customer fail to finalize such acceptance testing in the allotted time period (bar any failure on Compass Plus side which caused delay to acceptance testing, and in such case acceptance testing period shall be extended by the amount of time attributable to such delay) such professional services shall be deemed accepted and payment for them due or deferred period will be counted from the date of such acceptance testing period expiration.

Level.Name: Deferred conditionally
Level.Description: 1. Advance payment of at least 10% of the total value of professional services fees is made no later than 30 calendar days following contract signature 2. Remaining amounts are payable following the occurrence of a certain event, such as 'go live', successful migration, first production transaction being processed on the system, etc - i.e. that are not under direct control of Compass Plus, and are not direct deliverables of the professional services being provided 3. Customer is required to finalize acceptance testing of a particular delivery item within no later than 30 calendar days following the notification by Compass Plus of such delivery item being ready for acceptance testing. Should customer fail to finalize such acceptance testing in the allotted time period (bar any failure on Compass Plus side which caused delay to acceptance testing, and in such case acceptance testing period shall be extended by the amount of time attributable to such delay) such professional services shall be deemed accepted and payment for them due or deferred period will be counted from the date of such acceptance testing period expiration.

Level.Name: Nonstandard
Level.Description: Any other payment schedule not fitting the descriptions above.

AuthLevel.Name: Support and Maintenance Fees Payment Terms
AuthLevel.Description: Payment terms for regular (monthly/quarterly) support and maintenance fees by the customer according to the proposal
AuthLevel.MemoText: 1. Payments commence upon delivery of the software products 2. Payments are due within 3 business days following the invoice receipt by the customer 3. Invoices are raised by Compass Plus at the beginning of each calendar month in which the support and maintenance service is due to be provided, and in the case of incomplete month, the amount will be pro-rated accordingly
AuthLevel.MemoHeader: Support and Maintenance Fees Payment Terms For This Proposal:

Level.Name: Standard
Level.Description: 1. Payments commence upon delivery or installation of the software products (exact choice of event is at the discretion of the sales rep) 2. Payments are done in advance if they are done on annual or quarterly basis, and can be in arrears if those are monthly payments

Level.Name: Deferred unconditionally
Level.Description: 1. Payments commence no later than one calendar year following the contract signature with no conditions that can extend this period 2. Payments are done in advance if they are done on annual or quarterly basis, and can be in arrears if those are monthly payments

Level.Name: Deferred conditionally
Level.Description: 1. Payments commence conditionally upon occurrence of a certain event, such as completion of professional services or part thereof, 'go live', successful migration, first production transaction being processed on the system, etc 2. Payments are done in advance if they are done on annual or quarterly basis, and can be in arrears if those are monthly payments

Level.Name: Nonstandard
Level.Description: Any other payment schedule not fitting the descriptions above.

AuthLevel.Name: Deal Value
AuthLevel.Description: Total value of the deal, calculated as: End-User Total License Fee + End-User Total Professional Services Fees + First Year of Support and Maintenance Fees

Level.Name: 1 Million USD
Level.Description: Deals value is less or equal to 1 Million USD

Level.Name: 5 Million USD
Level.Description: Deals value is less or equal to 5 Million USD

Level.Name: More than 5 Million USD
Level.Description: Deals value is more than 5 Million USD

File.Name: PCT_start.vbs
File.Hint: PCT runner in case you have Nokia PC Suite installed

File.Name: PCT Distributive
File.Hint: Latest version of PCT software for installation.
